722374f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 93rd Street (East)
722374f-a.text:
Park Avenue, at the N. W. corner of East 93rd Street, showing the Ursuline Academy prior to demolishment for a 5 story building. This structure was originally built
by Ceneral Scott.
August 1911
Underhill, photographer
Gift of Urbrock Collection
REPRODUCTION RICRIS UNENONN
Ne w916

722373f.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 93rd Street
722373f.text:
Park Avenue t N. W. corner of 97rd Street. The old residence, at the time shown occupied by the Ursuline Acedemy, is about to be demolished for s five-story fireproof building. (Note sion hung on the south wsll). It is shown on the 1879 map: it was probably built in that decade, and stood alone in the block for a number
of years.
Auaust 1911.
Gift of I.N. Phelps Stokes.

722375f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 93rd Street
722375f-a.text:
1172 Park Avenue at S.W. corner of 93rd Street, replacing four
5-story houses.
Summer 1926.
American Photo Service, Inc.,

722376f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 93rd Street
722376f-a.text:
Park Avenue, east side, north from 93rd Street. In the right foreground is seen the George Ehret mansion and garden recently sold and about to be demolished for the erection of an apartrent house. The new apartment houses in the bsckground, between 95th and 96th
Streets, were both built since 1925.
June 3, 1928.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

722379f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 93rd Street
722379f-a.text:
(1)
1197 Park Avenue, at S. E. corner of 94th Street, from S. W. corner of 93rd Street, shwwing Mension and garden of the lete George Ehret, brewer, which were soid that spring for three million
dollars, and are sbout to be demolished.
June 3, 1928.
P.L. Sperr,Photogrepher.
(2)
The same, taken from the sidewalk in front of 1180 Park Avenue,
and showing the front door more clearly.
June 3, 1928.
P.L. Sperr,Ehotographer.
(3)
The same. The old 8eorge Ehret mahsion and garden, some fifty years old, which were sold that spring by his estete, ere about
to be demolished for an apartment house.
The car making the turn down 94th Street to the east is an old
T-model Ford.
June 3, 1928.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
